column1: #Text=BDSM as business : An interview with the owners of a dungeon
#Text=Your exposure to this is probably primarily what you see in movies , scanning magazines , scanning the Internet , just snippets everywhere .
#Text=It 's portrayed as though it 's dark , black and evil .
#Text=I do wear a lot of black .
#Text=If you look at the rooms , there 's all the accouterments you 'd find in these types of places --
#Text=but more than anything , there 's a lot of good feeling around here .
#Text=We hire the opposite of what you 'd think we would hire , what the average person would think we would hire .
#Text=I remember one of our ads that I had put in said , " If you think nice girls do n't do S&M , " -- I forgot what the rest of it said --
#Text=Yeah , " think again " or something like that .
#Text=And that ad had pulled so many girls , because they -- I think they all thought that nice girls do n't do this .
#Text=And a bunch of them had called and they said , " Wow . "
#Text=And I think I remember , a bunch of guys called because of that also .
#Text=It varies ; look around Manhattan , look around rents , look around build-outs , look around hiring , look around advertising ...
#Text=The single most costly thing we spend on is rent and advertising , those two together make up the bulk of what we spend .
#Text=There 's supplies , and there 's wear and tear and maintenance , and bookkeeping and things like that that you have to do .
#Text=The hardest thing in running this business , which is why people ca n't do it , is the relationship that my wife has with the gals and with the customers .
#Text=A lot on the web , we 've used most of the local city papers , New York Press , things like that , L Magazine .
#Text=Typically in the back of the paper .
#Text=Magazines constantly change their policy on it ; they want it , they do n't want it ...
#Text=Who 's buying the paper , who 's selling the paper .
#Text=So it changes , so one year we got to be in the Press , but they have now stopped adult ads .
#Text=So now we 'll be in the Voice for a while .
#Text=We 're moving more towards the Internet at this point , because the Internet is a much easier , safer way for a person to look at sensitive material and not get caught with it .
#Text=Personality test questions given to prospective mistresses .
#Text=Pursuant to your business question : we only hire nice people .
#Text=I do n't care if a girl is absolutely exquisite looking --
#Text=My husband has met beautiful , beautiful girls --
#Text=-- and he 's in the end , he would say , " Well , I wo n't hire them . "
#Text=I wo n't hire them . I hire --
#Text=Because I want someone who 's going to treat people nicely and well .
#Text=How can you tell whether they will or will not ?
#Text=Having been a psychologist for a number of years gives me a leg up on it .
#Text=And I have made him hire these girls , and ultimately he 's been right
#Text=They 've been complete pain in the asses !
#Text=I also have a profile they fill out for me , a mini-MMPI that I developed , so that I have an idea -- Rebecca and I put it together
#Text=I do n't know if you 'd like to see one .
#Text=So I have a mini-MMPI that I --
#Text=Could I have a sample , not necessarily one that 's filled out , but just one that you --
#Text=What would a question like " the greatest woman in the world " reveal to you ?
#Text=No question would reveal anything independently of all the questions together --
#Text=-- but I have a chart that I 'll go through ; the MMPI .
#Text=The baseline data that I use to --
#Text=You get a baseline from asking girls and refining profiles --
#Text=I do n't know , the O.J. Simpson ….
#Text=What would that be an indicator of ?
#Text=I 'm not sure which one you gave him , but there 's a brief , brief , brief IQ test there .
#Text=No , because I really ca n't call and tell them I 'm yeah , so-and-so 's applying here for a position .
